entry.et: Middle English, perhaps of Scandinavian origin; akin to Norwegian dialect bugge important man

def.dt: :of great strength
:of great force a big storm
:large or great in dimensions, bulk, or extent a big house
:large or great in quantity, number, or amount a big fleet
:operating on a large scale big government
:capital 1
:pregnant
:nearly ready to give birth
:full to bursting :swelling big with rage
:full and resonant
:chief preeminent the big issue of the campaign
:outstandingly worthy or able a truly big man
:of great importance or significance the big moment
:imposing pretentious
:marked by or given to boasting big talk
:magnanimous generous was big about it
:popular soft drinks are very big in Mexico Russ Leadabrand
:full-bodied and flavorful used of wine
:strongly favoring or liking
:noted for she is big on blushing Arnold Hano
:in a loud or declamatory manner
:in a boasting manner talk big
:to a large amount or extent won big
:on a large scale think big
:hard hits her forehand big
:an individual or organization of outstanding importance or power
:major league usually used in plural playing in the bigs
:a band that is larger than a combo and that usually features a mixture of ensemble playing and solo improvisation typical of jazz or swing
:the cosmic explosion that marked the beginning of the universe according to the big bang theory compare big crunch
:a theory in astronomy: the universe originated billions of years ago in an explosion from a single point of nearly infinite energy density compare steady state theory
:music (as rock) characterized by a heavy persistent beat

entry.et: Sir Benjamin Hall †1867 English Chief Commissioner of Works

def.dt: :a large bell in the clock tower of the Houses of Parliament in London
:the tower that houses Big Ben
:the clock in the tower
:bluestem 1
:of, relating to, or being a large chain store having a boxlike structure
